snippet.title: Road Trip 2011
snippet.description: CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman travels to Europe for his annual Road Trip adventure.

snippet.title: 2012 Dodge Charger R/T Road & Track
snippet.description: The much-improved 2012 Dodge Charger R/T offers a good blend of power and cabin technology, but could use a bit more refinement where efficiency and ease of use are concerned.

snippet.title: I'm Watch
snippet.description: The Iâ€™m Watch smartwatch runs Android and custom apps, but weak software and quirky performance mean you should pass on this pricey gadget.

snippet.title: Lenovo YOGA Tablet 10 HD+
snippet.description: The new Yoga Tablet 10 HD+ is a step up from previous entries in the line, at least in terms of specs.

snippet.title: 2014 Range Rover Sport
snippet.description: Except for the Meridian audio system, cabin tech in the 2014 Range Rover Sport remains run-of-the-mill, but this SUV's on- and off-road capabilities are truly extraordinary.

snippet.title: 2014 Subaru Forester
snippet.description: The 2014 Subaru Forester makes some interesting stabs at advanced technology, but its true value still lies in its all-wheel-drive system, fuel economy, and practical interior space.

snippet.title: Road Trip puts iPhone 4 and iPad to the test
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: Each year, CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman gets the chance to test out Apple's latest over several thousands of miles of driving. This year, that meant the iPhone 4, the iPad 3G, and the latest 13-inch MacBook Pro.

snippet.title: At 2,000 miles, Road Trip 2010 hits the suburbs
snippet.description: You have to cross milestones somewhere, and for CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman, making it to 2,000 miles of driving on Road Trip 2010 happened on a side street in Southington, Conn.

snippet.title: On Road Trip, a thumbs-up for Porsche's Panamera
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: It wouldn't be possible to tackle weeks' worth of reporting spread over 13 states without a good car, and for that, CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman got the chance to drive 5,000 miles in Porsche's Panamera.

snippet.title: Why I'm quitting Microsoft Office forever
snippet.description: It's not just about the money. Well, okay, it's mostly about the money, but there are other reasons I'm bidding goodbye to Microsoft's not-so-sweet suite.
